messages.message:
:meow_code::meow_code::meow_code::meow_code::meow_code::meow_code::meow_code:

hi team - designer here wanting to get a poll of who would benefit from having a dev mode seat in Figma. @Liam Callanan and I noticed that the free version of dev mode intentionally hides details that make handoff work more difficult and we’re looking into getting dev mode seats for those who would benefit most.

:meow_code::meow_code::meow_code::meow_code::meow_code::meow_code::meow_code:

Just react with a hand below - thanks!

i think i already have a paid dev mode seat, so i’m good!

what are the details hidden in the free version of dev mode? @Liam Callanan
Looks like you have a design seat Serena - you probably requested it at some point? They rotate them between people
The design seats are much more expensive than the dev seats
I don’t get dev mode at all anymore which I think is true for most engs
yup, didn’t they make that change in the last few months to get dev mode?
Yea I definitely haven't had access to dev mode ever since Figma took it out of beta

in that case, all the frontend engineers should have dev seats
• Weiming
• Liam
• Jessica
• Serena
• Danny
• Udit
• Xindi
• Paul
• Subash
• Aayush
@Dave is that feasible in terms of cost? or do we need to rotate seats?

We've been rotating seats as Dev is a sunset of Design so it has been more cost effective to rotate design seats.

We're happy to provision anyone with a design seat on demand through an <mailto:ithelp@instabase.com|ithelp@instabase.com> ticket
(To note deprovisioning only occurs when your last edit is over 30 days ago AND we are at the seat count otherwise we leave things in place. Read permissions are always maintained.)
is it possible to purchase additional dev-only seats?

Yes it is possible but thus far hasn't made much sense financially with the rotation model. Having the more versatile seats that can be used for both Dev and Design had helped make the seats more reusable for those making regular use.

got it and how many design seats do we have for rotation?

@Liam Callanan @Jessica what do you think about rotating frontend engineers through the existing design seats?

We set the number entirely based on who is provisioned, so as long as users are editing within that 30 day window we ensure they stay licensed.

The good news is we have effectively already been rotating design seats to cover this need, so we wouldn't need to change anything materially here.
TL;DR if someone needs it they just submit a ticket and the Dev edit rights will stay until they go 30 days without an edit
